reviewTitle: Anyone who gave this movie a 10 should not be allowed to review movies.
reviewBody:
***Warning...possible spoilers***
This movie was fine, but it was not great. It did a somewhat satisfactory job of bringing together all of the previous MCU movies...certainly no easy task. However, there was very little action, most of the jokes fell flat, and the emotional scenes didn't reverberate. Also, there were just too many obvious plot holes, both within the whole time-travel theme and in general. It just wasn't a great story or a great job of storytelling. I'll admit that I'm not an emotional person, but anyone who said they cried (especially some of the critics who said they cried, cried, laughed, cried, cheered, and cried some more) has never seen an actual well-made movie with a great story. I didn't cry at the end of Infinity War, and I certainly didn't get even the slightest bit emotional in Endgame. I also saw critics who said everyone stood and cheered when it was over. I definitely didn't experience that. Our theater just sat pretty quietly with quite a few conversations about the gaping plot holes. Again, not a bad movie, but it certainly didn't live up to what I was hoping for.

This is probably one of the most anticipated blockbusters of the moment, with Star Wars: Episode IX - The Rise of Skywalker (2019). The previous opus of the Avengers series, Avengers: Infinity War (2018), had left 'us' high and dry, in the depths of the abyss, while the latest episode of the Marvel Cinematic Universe, Captain Marvel (2019), gave 'us' back a glimmer of hope.In short, I saw it in Paris this morning and I enjoyed it. It's an efficient blockbuster. The script and the manifold plot twists permanently keep the audience spellbound and breathless. This movie is one of the funniest and one of the most spectacular of the complete Marvel Cinematic Universe saga, not to mention an astonishing Computer-Generated Imagery, despite manifold script weaknesses that I will partially reveal below, within a dedicated post-script.Otherwise, a very unusual observation, at least within Paris: the audience has repeatedly applauded, at least 7/8 times, including the very beginning and the end of the movie, conveying an uncontrollable impatience, like a collective catharsis boosted to the extreme. And a female teen, about 17/18 years old, not far from me, cried. Literally! The audience was obviously made up of fans conquered beforehand... and that was part of the show!So Marvel, what's next? I am probably addicted and certainly impatient!As a post-script, a few remarks, annoyances or even irritations:1) First, a tiny spoiler as a favor. You will get absolutely nothing at the very end. Contrary to the Marvel habits and customs, there is no post-credit scene.2) The first half-hour is an immeasurable disappointment. While Thanos had, in the first opus, undertaken a Herculean task, a titanic challenge, a Homeric Odyssey in order to gather the 6 infinity stones and "bring balance to the universe" as a demiurge, in the second opus, he contents himself with a miserable and lonely life such as a peasant from the Middle Ages, because "the stones served no purpose beyond temptation". Wooooow! Literally incredible.3) Who understood this quote from Tony Stark to Steve Rogers? "It's the EPR paradox. Instead of pushing Lang through time, you might have wound up pushing time through Lang". Honestly, I do not know if we need an IQ above 250 or below 60 to understand this quote...4) During the manifold fights versus the Avengers, we do not really see the difference between Thanos with the 6 infinity stones and Thanos without: his power seems unchanged!5) Time travel exists fundamentally in two versions: a change in the past will or will not have an impact in the future. Even if the first category is the most representative with classics such as The Terminator (1984) or Back to the Future (1985), Avengers: Endgame (2019) clearly belongs to the second category.6) For their time heist, the Avengers break down into 3 separate teams to join 3 distinct time-spaces in which there are 3 Thanos. One Thanos in each space-time: New-York in 2012, Asgard in 2013, Morag+Vormir in 2014. During 60 minutes, we follow these 3 concomitant stories. The Thanos from 2014 discovers and understands the whole intrigue thanks to his daughter Nebula. Nevertheless, the Avengers are able to switch from one space-time to another one, thanks to a protective suit, a GPS bracelet and a capsule containing Pym particles. Thus, these three elements are specially designed by Tony Stark, with the posthumous help of Hank Pym, for such an expedition and are a priori mandatory for the way in and the way back. But we do not really know how, the Thanos from 2014 will go back in time with his faithful right-hand man Ebony Maw, the whole armada and a huge spaceship. Wooooow! Even alone, this time-travel should be impossible.7) For the time heist in Vormir, why Natacha Romanoff and Clint Barton have to go first through Morag, with James Rhodes and Nebula? The Avengers could have splitted the whole team in 4 instead of 3 from the start, right? So, why 3 teams instead of 4? Knowing that I see no reason for this detour via Morag, I think that the scriptwriters were desperately stuck and were looking for a way for the Thanos of 2014 to recover a free fast-pass, i.e. a protective suit + a GPS bracelet + a Pym capsule. Those of the mortal remains of Natacha Romanoff. Except that the Thanos of 2014 was absolutely not aware of the presence of this corpse on Vormir. In any way!8) The scriptwriters have combined two ultra-complex concepts, i.e. time travel and quantum realm, in order to optimally cheat the audience. Indeed, when Tony Stark and Steve Rogers are back in New-York, they are magically able to time-travel from New-York in 2012 to Camp Lehigh in 1970 without the help of any quantum tunnel device...9) .... and so on ... and so on ... The screenwriters had obviously bigger eyes than belly! In short, this is a typical pop corn movie: turn your brain off, and then, and then only, enjoy the show!10) At last, a two-penny question: where did they find inspiration for the hairstyles? A moronic soccer player for Clint Barton, undoubtedly. Without forgetting Carol Danvers, or how to disfigure a sex bomb with a pair of scissors?That's all, folks!

reviewTitle: Way too much humor kills it
reviewBody: Main problem with this movie is too much humor it forces you to get through the whole time... Action builds up, heats up, ....killed by an absolutely stupid 'supposed to be funny' joke...this and time travel idea was so lame.. cudnt they think of more out of the box ideas? Of course if you go back in time u will win .. so lame.. and movie runs way too long to give u the nice main actions scene the last hour.. other avengers has more main action sequences than that... Not to mention that they totally destroyed the idea of the hulk once they made him wear freakin glasses and turn him into a smart ass funny character.. last movie doesnt have to be the best... Actually the 10/10 reviews make me wonder... Was I watching the same film? Can the fact that you are a fanboy makes u like sth ridiculous as this?

I am not going to spoil too much. I just got disappointed with the storyline..
I believe superhero origins were missing in this movie. Character was developed with the lowest priority. And the ending was specially disappointing..
I expected a power punch of the superheroes what I missed specially of Thor.
This movie just gave me an example of highest hype with lower result.

reviewTitle: It's still Iron Man's world and the rest of the Avengers are still just living in it...
reviewBody: Well...most of them.The film opens on Jeremy Renner's Hawkeye with his happy family...until he no longer has one on account of them being dusted, which causes him to become vengeful Mohawkeye. Next up it's my least favourite Avenger, Tony Snark, teaching games to Nebula (my favourite Guardian of the Galaxy and the only one of those a-holes I actually LIKE. Mantis, who I also like and who *isn't* an a-hole, sadly only gets one line in the movie, but at least it's a funny one). The term drawn-out could be used to describe this whole opening with Tony. 'Self-indulgent' would be another. Just because you have a 3-hour+ runtime, Russos, doesn't mean you should waste it lingering on Tony sleeping, etc. I did appreciate, though, that Nebula shows she's grown (as evidenced by the fact she's refrained from beating the snot out of Tony the entire time they've been stuck in space together). I was happy to see her featured so much.Thankfully things finally get moving once Captain Marvel saves their butts and interacts with the team in a scene most have probably watched already. As she points out to Rhodey Rude (whose main role seems to be Joke/Movie Reference Man), she's been on other planets after 'The Snap' that *didn't* have The Avengers to help them out. The fact that THOR says he likes her should be enough (though obviously won't be for certain people). He also learns from the mistake he made at the end of Infinity War regarding what bodypart to aim for on Thanos (who apparently wiped out half the universe's populace so he could become a farmer and unfortunately destroyed the Infinity Stones). Too bad Nebula's robbed of the chance to end Thanos in this movie (twice!), as she probably deserved to the most. Tony the Drama Queen proves he hasn't grown at all, laying the blame for everything at Cap's feet.A skip to five years later reveals time hasn't been kind to Thor. I'm saddened to see him reduced to this joke, when the first Thor movie is one of my favourites. They've veered too far into 'comedy' for my taste, as here he's played mostly for laughs on account of letting himself go (for those wanting shirtless Thor, you'll get him...though you'll wish you *hadn't*). Bless Paul Rudd's Scott Lang, as he brings a breath of fresh air to proceedings. His reunion with his (now grown) daughter is one of the few genuinely effective emotional moments in the film. Unfortunately, he's not given the respect he deserves, considering he's the one to come up with the idea of time travel (the subject of which is given the ultimate nerd discussion in this film). They go to Tony, who selfishly refuses to help the others get back everyone they lost since he already HAS everyone HE wants (well...except for Spider-Kid, who is the reason he eventually changes his mind).Cut to after a 'comedic' sequence involving working out the kinks of time-travelling, the gang splits up to retrieve all the stones from the past. This is where the film kicks into gear, as we revisit past MCU films and encounter previous versions of characters. Highlights include: Cap seeing Peggy Carter again, Cap vs Past Cap, Thor spending some precious time with his soon-to-be-deceased mother (plus, a Jane cameo! There's actually lots of cameos in the film, but only a few I cared about) and twice the amount of Nebula. There's one rage-inducing consequence of visiting the past involving Mohawkeye, Natasha and the Soul Stone. If you remember what happened with Gamora, you'll know what that means. Although the character who ends up being the sacrifice gets some good character/emotional beats in this film, it still doesn't make up for the fact they're unceremoniously given the 'permadeath' treatment, thus robbing us of one of the MCU's best characters and the awesome dynamics between them and other characters. Given all the others that could've been offed, WHY'd it have to be...well...you'll see.I'll give the film credit for seamlessly blending the 'present' characters with the past, and once things reach the climax, they definitely ensure this is the most 'epic' battle we've seen yet which involves pretty much every character (except those who're unfortunate enough to *stay* dead, of course), some of which will be getting future films or TV shows to appear in. I guess that's meant to 'make up for' them not getting much screentime here (like my fave, Wanda. At least she gets some revenge on Thanos and shares an emotional moment with Mohawkeye near the end. I'm looking forward to her show and hopefully future movie appearances too). Captain America gets at least two cheer-worthy moments, while Captain Marvel and her new haircut get to kick some major arse (don't fret, haters...she isn't given the final victory over Thanos. No, we all know who gets THAT privilege).I guess I was supposed to feel sad near the end, but honestly I just felt relief, as it's about time a certain someone faced some actual real consequences. Hopefully other characters will get to thrive/have substantial screentime now that somebody isn't hogging it all. Another good thing about the end is the camera shot which slowly moves through/covers everyone (all these characters we've come to know, plus a few we haven't yet) at the funeral. The BEST part, however, is the final scene. I've waited ever since the first Cap movie (my other fave MCU film) to get to the scene that ends this movie, and I think it's worth it. I'm so very happy with it and who it involves.While there're no mid-credits/post-credits scenes, it's worth sticking around to see the original six Avengers actors literally signing off. It'll probably take a couple of viewings to fully digest this film, as it throws in everything AND the kitchen sink. It's a fitting conclusion to Phase 3 (ignoring Spider-Kid 2). Now, bring on Phase 4!

reviewTitle: A Great Mis-opportunity to be the 2 perfect movie
reviewBody:
They try to be different but it just doesnt do it for me. I already dislike Infinity war and the first half of this movie confirm my view. The first act of this movie should have been included in the infinity war. And that would make infinity war the perfect movie... Why? Just why are they doing it like this? Cut some unnecessary scene in the infinity war to get that 3 hour screen time and then end the film with Thanos head. We will face the shock of reality that even when they defeat the villain, its not enough. The world already changed. And then start the sequel, 5 year after, with that time travel plot. And rework the movie with a better story, or if you can, just give a brief explaination about the time travel plot so that it didnt resulting in a huge paradox like this. For movie goers the current plot is okayish but for scifi nerd this is unacceptable. The lost of one of the avenger is a pure tearjerk but the other one doesnt make any sense. It could have been done better with a different character.
Overall it is okay for entertainment if you dont think too much about it. But I feel unsatisfied with what they are doing. I really do feel it could be better.

reviewTitle: Worthy conclusion, but not the most entertaining marvel movie
reviewBody: For me the movie felt different than other marvel movies. The pace was slower overall. Cannot say I was fully entertained thoughout the entire movie. Trying to give all the characters an adequate screentime and development made this movie so long and wasnt benefical for the tension. It felt really stretched at some points.Thor is literally a joke in this movie. One of the most developed and powerful characters we have seen in the past. Would have expected him to beat the **** out of thanos and his troops, but he was pretty much useless in retrospective. Instead we have Captain Marvel that outshines the other characters powers by far, plus no one wants to see this because she is just flat and unappealing.I also expected more of Thanos, his sudden change of mind wasnt very relatable after the determined / balanced seeming Thanos weve seen in the previous movie. Some things just felt underwhelming about this movie.

reviewTitle: Definitely not what you would expect.
reviewBody:
But I can't really tell if that's a good thing or not.I appreciate that Marvel is trying something different with this movie, that they changed their working formular to create something new, but for me it sadly didn't work out.In comparison to Infinity War, Endgame is just.....nh. Disappointing.
If you've seen all the other MCU movies you might get a kick out of all the references and jokes based on those, that's the stuff I greatly enjoyed. Endgame didn't take itself and it's characters too seriously and at times this worked out really well. But regretfully, there are others parts where this change of plans destroyed the movie for me.
I don't know, turning Thor into an alcoholic, lazy dude who does nothing besides playing Fortnite (yes, Fortnite is in this movie) all day just isn't funny at all and ruins the hard work Taika Waititi has put into him. I also hate what they did to Hulk/Banner, I always thought Banner was an extremly likeable and interesting character, but in this movie I couldn't stand him.
Most of the other characters are just _fine_, Tony and Steve being the only ones who really stand out. Endgame gives either of those characters important decisions to make and their dynamic is absolutely entertaining.
Steve's ending though was just awful. Not only was it predictable ever since we knew time travel would be part of the plot, it wasn't satisfying at all. Steve leaving his two best friends behind, who he hadn't seen in f i v e years, just to hang with the girl he met for a few weeks eighty years ago AFTER he already made out with her niece is just unbearable. Awful. Why would you do that.I liked the ending they gave Tony, it was fitting for his character and regarding his importance for the whole MCU he deserved a big goodbye.
To be honest, I would've liked it more if they gave Steve the big, heroic death and let Tony live in retirement with his family but hey, whatever.So in conclusion, after first watching it I really expected more. This just wasn't the big ending I was promised, it was weird at times and overall fine at best. I don't think it was necessary to make it three hours long. The Russo Brothers directed all of my favourite MCU movies so far, but this one was a total miss.
Wouldn't recommend if you're not a fan.

I want to begin by saying that had this been a standalone movie I would have probably given it a 4 or 5, but for this particular movie, the movie of the decade, the big conclusion everything was leading up to, mediocre-ness is worse than complete failure. We were promised a masterpiece and we received something that what so-so at best.
I'll break down what I think went wrong, so spoilers ahead:
The biggest issue with this movie is the ever-paradoxical use of time travel. Unless you are making a silly comedy like "Back to the Future" it always messes with continuity and no matter how well you try to explain that the canon reality does not just collapse under the paradox, it is always going to feel like the lazy way out, and so it did in this one. Steve deciding to go rogue back to the 40s, thus ignoring all the character development he went through and irreparably messing with every timeline is not exactly the extremely satisfying closure we were promised in interviews with directors and actors. Overall I suppose the expectations were just so high that nothing could have lived up to it, but with the amounts of money and the access to great creators Marvel has I really would have expected something else- something as creative and mind-blowing as they promised instead of the honestly mediocre at best time-travel flick we got. Messing with timelines and essentially de-canonizing large chunks of the MCU just was not what I was hoping for.
Another thing I had a problem with is that this movie was supposed to perfectly conclude every character's arc so far. We were promised a suitable ending of some journeys and at least a crucial point in everyone else's. Instead, Black Widow was killed without ever even allowing her to develop a character. Thor, who could have been the ideal king of Asgard was turned into a fatphobic joke by equating his chubbiness with sloppiness (personally, I liked his new look. Thor looked rather like a man who is strong from physical labour than planned workouts and diet plans, but the way they dressed him in dirty clothes, made him lazy and greasy is just so terrible), while the lessons he learned in Ragnarok and the sacrifices he made did not seem to have any effect at all; the loyalty he felt to his people completely disappeared. Iron Man was ripped of his peaceful retirement, where for the first time he was allowed to try to heal, just because someone had to die dramatically.
Don't misunderstand me, I am not bitter that they killed off beloved characters, in fact I understand that it had to happen, however I would have loved to see them take the characters' arcs into account. In my opinion, Steve should have died because he has no place in either the future or the past, and his mission is completed. Tony, on the other hand, should have lived because he finally made an effort to heal and overcome his trauma. I don't mean to suggest that one or another character should or should not have died, I only think I might have been able to accept the way things turned out if there was a reasonable plot leading up to it that made their death a logical conclusion. The Marvel movies are fictional and everyone who goes to watch them is very aware of the fact that there is a team of writers and creators who crafted everyone's arc and worked on it for a long time. I would have appreciated to watch the outcome reflect the amount of work and time I am sure many people put into this project.
Ultimately I have to admit that the messages we get to take away from this film are what really made me sad: People with trauma don't deserve to heal, people's actions and experiences have seemingly no consequences, and friendship and found family mean nothing against the ideal of a romantic relationship.This is a very long movie and so there are many more things I could address, for example the "Hail Hydra" scene, Steve wielding Mjolnir, how similar this movie was to the last one, Loki's unexplained disappearance in the past timeline, the cheap attempt of making up for the lack of lgbt heroes by showing a mlm extra in one scene, the list goes on. But all those things seem somehow related to the major issues I addressed earlier. Perhaps the hype was too big, perhaps the team did get lazy and rested on the success of the franchise or perhaps it is just me expecting too much from a superhero movie.
Regardless, if you loved this movie, I see your point, it is in many ways what we were expecting, but what I was hoping for was something new, something revolutionary that would surprise and amaze me. Maybe in another ten or twenty years we will get that movie I thought this was going to be, but I am afraid that by then I will not be interested anymore.

reviewTitle: An epic, beautiful and heart-wrenching finale to the whole franchise.
reviewBody:
The trailers to this film are completely misleading. It painted a bleak, inevitable outcome for the surviving heroes after Thanos's devastating snap that left the whole universe in ruins.It goes into a completely different direction than I originally expected. For one thing, it's much funnier than I thought.
It's also nothing like Infinity War. It's basically a mix of many other marvel movies all wrapped into one epic heist film.Its lengthy time run does get a bit problematic at times, but by the time the climactic battle sequence comes by the end, you forget all about it. Those who had been disappointed or despondent by Infinity War will rejoice when seeing this one.The film is a true testament to sacrifice, love and loss. Obviously I laughed, I cried and I clapped. This is truly cinematic history.

I saw the movie this tuesday ☺ (3 days before US ).
Too long, no post credits scene, too cheesy at some points.
And too many bad ideas...
The movie is set 5 YEARS LATER then infinity wars...WTF...
Thanos dies twice 🤣🤣🤣,
Hulk is ridiculous
Thor is ridiculous
The remade of the Thanos /Gamora Vormir scene by Hawkeye /BlackWidow is ridiculous
Cheesy sacrifice of Tony Stark with a "Batman v Superman" inspired funeral scene
Anthony McKee the new Captain America WTF...And few good ideas ....
Time paradoxes (where is Loki ?), funny scenes
Captain using Thor's helmet (surely the greatest idea or the movie)

reviewTitle: Marvel should have known to stop at Infinity war itself !!
reviewBody: I've loved every single Marvel movie because they brought about this level of authenticity, humor, love, loss, failure, strength and a sense of unity to us fans. They weren't just movies, they were pure entertainment. Therefore, as much as it hurts me to say this, I was terribly disappointed with this movie.Don't get me wrong, there were moments which got me thinking, 'Ok this is it' , just to be disappointed again. It was terribly funny to Thor looking fat and drunk but he was pretty much useless through the entire movie. He didn't do anything other than sulk and cry. He didn't even use his hammer and it was Captain America that did half the work for him . The entire plot about quantum realm time travelling was so vague that I never understood what was happening. It felt like they thought about time travelling as a last ditch attempt to keep the story going. Hulk was the biggest disappointment of them all. He's supposed to be the strongest avenger, the mightiest and all that. Instead we get a version of "Best of both worlds" ??If I have to compare this to any other time travelling movies or shows, let's just say that this movie is the worst of them all. Except for when Tony and Natasha die, every other emotional scene felt forced and fake.With regards to Captain Marvel, they needn't have wasted their money and time with an introduction movie for her because she didn't do anything in this movie. Fine, she blasts through Thano's ship and gives everyone respite from the ceaseless bombings but her only other appearance is twice or thrice. And she's got a cool haircut..

Will probably get killed with dislikes, but hear me out before you come at me:To set things straight; yes this was a good action movie. Was it more than that? Not really. Let me explain why.1. The whole thing about fortnite, hulk-dabs and fatty-Thor was really .. unnecessary. I really love how Marvel use humor in their movies - but this is reaching.2. I love paying for long movies, but I hate checking my watch mid-playtime. It felt like some parts of the movie could've been clipped out to keep the flow going a little better.3. The last fight scene has been named by some as one of the best ever on screen. I have to disagree. The clash was both very messy and clumsy. It was hard to focus on what really happened, and it felt like they had to bring just everything without thinking about how it looked on screen. Personally I felt nothing special about it, and there were really never a point we're i wondered if our heroes would prevail...To sum my review up; Marvel has ended one of their best series, and they did it in a decent way. Sadly it feels like they are trying to please more children, especially when they force stuff like Fortnite and dabbing into the movie. I'm disappointed, but yet I had a good time.

Literally might be the dumbest movie I've ever seen. Thanos dies in the first five minutes of the movie. They fill the rest of the movie with flashbacks from the other Avenger movies. It's all recycled material and the whole production probably took five minutes.

The final chapter of the Avengers started of unexpected, but the 2 hours after that were boring, only focusing on some really cheasy jokes and there was barely a story line. They messed up a few major characters big time and only later in the film I began to enjoy the movie. The ending was of course really sad and I had a certain sympathy for the characters.

reviewTitle: No room for a toilet break
reviewBody: Just back from the theatre. Positioned myself beside the exit so I could slip out to the bathroom knowing it was just over three hours long, but so much was happening on the screen that I had to cross my legs. Exceptional ending to a fantastic decenium of action. There is no post credits which makes absolute sense so no need to sit through credits if you don't find it interesting.

reviewTitle: Really slow pace... only action during last 30 minutes.
reviewBody: This movie had a really slow pace before moving into action.. First 1,5 hours there's nothing exciting happening... Thank God the movie had a beautiful ending with respect for all characters.Warning the next section contains spoilers...:First act is about everybody mouring over the loss of people cause the snap. No action at all and it looks like a drama movie here. Really boring in fact.The second act is the time travelling thing, also no action in here but a lot of funny moments though. Everyone in the theatre was laughing multiple times.There's only action during the third act.. Great action scenes and surprises here. But sometimes it felt like it was a little bit rushed. Thanos is also extremely (unrealistically?) powerful without the gountlet. Not a lot of screenplay for the children of Thanos. I think they could have done more with the Maw for example.If you compare the action of infinity war to this one, it looks like there wasn't enough money left for it... Maybe most of the money went to ALL the actors within MCU for reappearing all again in this movie for a couple of minutes?

First like 20 minutes, just wow. Then for like hour and the half it's bringing back old memories, just great. And that last battle for the end, gave everyone chills. I really liked that they showed that Thanos is super strong even without the gaunlet. Great humor as well. Only downside is timeline, I don't know what they did with that.
Btw Hulk, Antman and Thor were amazing. And for the end, thanks for everything Tony and Steve :)

An emotional climax full of action, humor and time travel. The first part kind of finishes Infinity War storyline by having Thor kill Thanos when the Avengers, together with Captain Marvel, find him in space. The story then jumps 5 years later as the characters deal with the after effects of Infinity War in their before they figure out a way to undo Thanos snap with the aid of Antman and his time travel time theory. The storyline seems to have lots of dialogues but then viewers are quickly rewarded with great action scenes. And Oh My God, the final battle with Thanos(who time travels from the past to the present) and his army is just awesome as you have all the heroes taking a part in the battle. And we also lose some of our favourite characters.
Average. 1st 2hr you will die. If are till the end, last 45 will satisfy you. It's Captain and Thor show and in the end we missed the Iron Man. Rip

reviewTitle: Not as good as Infinity War
reviewBody: I dont like how they killed iron man and black widow. Iron man kills himself and black widow also kills herself. what dosent make sense is they could have gone back in time to save them in the end but they dont. when iron man dies captain america ditches the avengers and goes back to the past to live with his old girlfriend leaving the avengers to fight thanos. basically this movie was disappointing for me and the ending is just bad.

reviewTitle: I mean, it's a marvel film
reviewBody: It was incredible fan-fare. It had really basic and generic music, basic cinematography, basic plot, basic motivations. There was some cool action, but most of it was cut awfully. It was predictable as hell, the jokes were eh, the reveals and climaxes were eh. I knew what was going to happen and when to whom.It was just eh.

This movie does everything right. I was so pleased and satisfied walking out of the theater, it's really hard to understate it. The Russo Brothers absolutely lived up to the expectations and delivered the epic conclusion we were all waiting for. You can probably nitpick this movie if you want (as you can any movie), but to me that's pretty much what you have to do to find flaw with it. I think that the emotions throughout are played so well and we get those moments with each character where they feel human, especially with all 6 of our original avengers. Each has their moment to shine and I truly loved it. The humor was well-used, the story made sense, the finale was downright perfect, and it was an all-around great movie!SPOILERS
My favorite stuff
The beginning with Clint's family was downright heartbreaking to watch, and a great way to bring that human aspect to the story, seeing someone who had no idea what was going on be affected by the snapThe subversion of expectation meeting thanos and realizing he not only doesn't have the stones but he doesn't carePaul Rudd. What a guy.The second act plot is really done well, it makes sense yet the way they go about it with the callbacks to almost every movie through cameos or reliving scenes is great, especially in the New York scenes (specifically the elevator scene from winter soldier being called back)-Black Widow dying is another expectation subversion and is done very well
Tony having a moment with his dad is great to seeThe way by which thanos is reintroduced as the villain is actually brilliant and gives a new perspective to his motivations and the way he destroys the facility after the reversal snap is greatCap picking up Thor's hammer is all kinds of yupGiving our main three some alone time fighting thanos is a great way to give them their time to shineAvengers Assemble is everything I didn't know I needed.Tony's arc is done so well and how he sacrificed himself reminds me so deeply of the scene in Avengers when cap said tony wouldn't sacrifice himself for others.Cap getting to dance with PeggyThor joins the Guardians!My negative stuff (these didn't really bother me that much but a little bit)
The whole fat Thor thing kinda makes some of the dramatic moments later on kinda weaker in my opinionSame with half-hulk, almost felt hard to take him seriously at first but it made more sense as the story grewNot sure I can buy thanos changing his mind for his plan to cleanse the universe by destroying it and starting over, but I like that he's willing to die for his own causewould've liked more action especially in the first act but I appreciated the emotions

I loved the movie and i only have two problems with it. They "nerfed" Thor way too much, I get it, he haven't been fighting for the last 5 years, but why didn't he fly up and destroy the Centauri ships of thanks ship when he's shooting at them. Captain marvel is strong.. we didn't need the "strong female moment" it REALLY ruined an otherwise good second meeting with captain marvel.. please just make it normal and not "oh hey look, we're treating women with respect" this is the opposite you're getting out of it..
this is the only problems I had with the movie otherwise amazing.. had to hold in a tear or two.

reviewTitle: What ever it takes - The greatest change of a character
reviewBody:
7 h ago I left zur cinema, but I m still left for words ... that movie totally flashed me even though I partly knew what would happen at the end (thats the problem With watching trailers so DON'T!)... I Think the last Time that happened to me was when I first saw LotR 3Even so the movie has its funny scenes it is much darker than most of the previous MCU movies...I really loved that beginning with hawkeye haveing a good time with his family but just seconds later he realized they are all gone cause of thanos snap...
So did the end...In a huge battle about Planet earth and the infinity glove You finally get to see that 1 out of 14 Million 6 hundred and 5 outcomes Dr. Strange saw... when the whole world and all ever seen MCU heroes fight thanos army (brought back by a snap of Hulk with time travelled Infinity gaunlet) Not Thor or Captain Marvel gets the final punch to end Thanos... it has to be the one all started with: IRON MAN ... just minutes after he holds Peter in his arms again he takes the Chance to sacrificed himself (he got a daughter with pepper now) and puts on the infinity gaunlet and snap away thanos and his army ... but also his Life (as the stones are to powerful) ... that was one hell of an emotional scene and that will be forever burnt in my mind
And there are others too that sacrificed their life: black widow gave her life to get hawkeye the soul stone (same as gamora did) and cap who is still alive but in his 80s now and took the chance to live his life with peggy while bringing back all infinity stones at the end of the movieEveryone knows that this is the best way to end avengers ... a heroic moment for Iron man the guy everything started with and changing his attitude in the best way ever possible...This is a 10/10 movie because it leaves u speechless... R.i.P Tony
The movie had everything . It was worth the wait. I laughed and cried at the end. It was the most perfect conclusion. I'm going to miss Tony , it was the perfect ending for him.

... well I missed something and... didn't like everything.This movie is great. It is a wonderful conclusion and causes lots of emotions.
I personally missed Goose. It would have been wonderful, if the flerken finally would have eaten up Thanos.It is, in my opinion, a pity that Falcon will be the new Cap and noch Bucky.It would have been great to see more of Cpt Marvel. But, hey, that's ok after all.But... it once said that no one can stand to handle or even hold a single Infinity Stone, but well, everybody does it in this film o.0Well, those are the flaws for me - anything else is nearly perfect. Maybe besides some... logical issues that always come along with that time travel thing.I was deeply impressed by the CGI, though I normally prefer practical effects. Thanos looked way better than in Infinity.And... I... ok I loved the scene, but... how could Tony even try for a second to use all stones...? Well, it doesn't matter - it was HIS moment. It has been the best way to good bye. What a heroic scene.

reviewTitle: I'm eager to write about this yet I'm also afraid. There's so much to this movie!
reviewBody: ***Minor Spoilers (that may be significant for some)***Avengers: Endgame is what happens a group of devoted filmmakers set up shop and pay off a decade's worth of storytelling on the big screen in a bombastic yet surprisingly satisfying way. First off, to prove I saw the movie, it starts off with Clint's family getting 'dusted' right after the SNAP in Infinity War. And from then on, it's a post-disaster movie trying to address the previous movie's aftermath. All the while it becomes a Back to the Future-like adventure on steroids and it even has Terminator callbacks as well. And it's got the emotional gravitas of Toy Story 3. Oh: and Thor's chubby in this, and a MASSIVE troll online whenever Korg needs him to be (in ### ######). It's got taught writing with just as focused direction telling a story through the action as opposed to action taking over the story.SEE THIS MOVIE! It's as much movie a movie can get this year! And we've still got PLENTY of other goods on the horizon still.5/5 stars.

The premise of the quantum realm and time travel in MCU is, when you change the past, you're not changing the future. You made alternate realities. Like how nebula is killing her past self yet she didn't die with her. And how Thanos came to the future and lost means there's a reality where he never got any Infinity stones, coz if it's the same reality, Guardians of Galaxy wouldn't even be assemble.Now, how could Rogers change his past yet he could still be in the "normal" reality?

The visual effects are spot on, as usually.
The 6/10 ranking has to due with Captain America ending.He ended up with Peggy, meaning he did not grow at all. He was still stuck in the past and life is about dealing with new circumstances and understand some doors are closed forever. Not only that, Peggy's story as a brave independent woman who fought for a better world loses some meaning.
It is also hard to believe Steve Rogers would stay quiet during 70+ years whilst Peggy would do the hard work.
Steve Rogers's ending is lazy, incoherent and cliche.Black Widow dies, sacrificing herself, meaning any solo movie with her is meaningless. Her death as some sense, but it still feels empty.Tony Stark also dies, after having a happy ending (at the beginning of the movie). I believe this death is going to be divisive.The loopholes with time travel are there (how does Peter resume his life with the same colleagues?) and are kinda disappointing the more you think about them.Marvel really went for the pockets of the consumers and didn't put in the effort to tide things up orderly.

First I would like to remark that it is my very own personal opinion and I don't want to scare anybody from watching this movie. Every MCU fan should watch this film, but as I, a comic fan as well, won't enjoy it as much as one expects it, in my opinion.
I grew up on these films and the crown of those films was unfortunately built merely on the last films for example Captain Marvel.
I don't want to speak about what would be better I better just say what I liked and what I did not.
I liked that the final battle was very comicish, and that this film explained a bunch of previous mysteries for instance how the Hydra got the scepter.
I disliked that the jokes were too childish for me and that the time travel was too sloppy.
I found a bit disrespectful what they did to Thor the god of thunder and I still don't understand why they boosted Captain America to be able to hold the Mjölnir and summon lightnings.
All in all I am a bit disappointed, I feel it is not worth my awaitings and I am a bit concerned what the future of our beloved characters will be.

reviewTitle: An end of an era for us.
reviewBody: I'm speechless best movie ever in the mcu history and Iron mans Death hit me hard I was crying my eyes out at the end overall really good movie

reviewTitle: Is this a Film or an Epic?
reviewBody:
I don't know if we ever could of imagined the state of Marvel comic-book movies 11 years after the first MCU film in 2008, to review this film as a movie a one of film, I don't think that would do it justice because as a single stand alone film (even though its a sequel) would not do it the proper justice , however this is the only way I know how to break down a film. I will judge the MCU as a whole in another review. If I was to sum this movie up as brief as possible its, Avengers end game is the fan service movie you didn't know you wanted, with a story and battles thrown in there to pad the run time.
Where the movie succeeds is in its grandeur and its design, it is extremely large scale, sometimes to its own detriment ( I looking at you final battle sequence ) but nevertheless you can feel the immensity of this epic, I will be breaking it down into several parts, Story, Cinematography, Actors/Actress , Characters, Motivations, Soundtrack, Pacing, Design, Re-watch ability & HeartStory
when you have a story that expands over 20 plus movies to culminate into one it is a hard task, but this movie does succeed in the story it has clear goals, which they seem to accomplish, sometimes without any resistance what so ever, the scene where Tony stark, just happens to make time travel possible after stating it could never be done, was a little jarring & every obstacle that they did eventually encounter was immediately remedied, antmans a baby then turn the power off , couldn't get the correct stone, just go back again, there seemed to be obstacles placed in there way in order for the heroes to just step over them, rather then a climb or hurdle, personally I feel it would have been better to have as many if they were not as significant, the part I loved was in the first act where we see a 5 year jump and the world is still in mourning over the vanishing of half the population, the arc in which Hawk eye is introduced again was a satisfying one, the lead up to the inevitable gathering of all the heroes from earth and beyond was something expected in the final act but was done in a way that would even simmer the harshest of critics, the killing of Thanos in the first 10 minutes was a pleasant surprise, but without a clear antagonist until about 1 hour and 45 minute mark, the story progression took a back seat for character development, Storyline Score 7.5/10Cinematography
Thankfully unlike a lot of the other MCU this film sense of Enormity was done quite well with the cinematography, while the standardised shot, reverse shots were very predominant, there are a few glorious moments, mainly involving the quantum realm & the final battle sequence, the colour scenes and lighting are an improvement on Infinity war up until the final battle, but the cold colour pallet sets the mood for a very different MCU film in the beginning , Cinematography Score 6/10Actors/Actress
To me this is where the movie shines its brightest as there is a range we see from many actors, the desperation in the beginning on Chris Hemsworth's face & the slight lip quiver and slightly tearing eyes of Scar-Jo allowed us to see this is a passionate cast we are dealing with, the subtleties of almost every actor in this film reflect the minor changes they have from shot to shot, with a show don't tell style which is refreshing for the MCU. Stand-outs are RDJ, Chris Evens & Scarlet Johansen
Actor/actress score 8.5/10Characters
Every character in this film felt like they had a role to play, and there wasn't too much cross over between them, rocket raccoon was the snippy one, ant-man was the comic relief however Thor was a problem to say the least, the running gag of him being a fat hair drunk was played up way to much and in almost every scene he was in we are constantly reminded that he is drunk and fat and hairy, he was the anti Thor to every other Thor portrayals & it wasn't because of what he went through it was because of how he was written. The characters develop properly in this and while there isn't many major arcs in the film involving characters the one of Tony stark from, being afraid to do anything because of the fear of losing his daughter or his daughter losing him transcending into the hero that defeated Thanos and died in the process, was not only touching but poetic, the sounds of sobbing where heard in the theatres and it was a (forgive the pun) stark reminder of what the characters mean to people here in the real world. Character score 7/10Motivations
Every movie has the characters that motivations make no sense - this film is no different , however as of writing this, I cannot find a world breaking character motivation that took me away from the film, they all had goals and did what they needed to do to achieve those goals. With one of the exception, when evil nebula comes back from the past, everyone seems to forget about her while sorting out the infinity stones, which felt like a plot device to allow her to bring Thanos to the future.
Motivations 9/10Soundtrack
The best part of the score was the nostalgic soundtracks when different characters were introduced and combined with the current score, the music in this film is generic and nothing to write home to, there is a distinct lack of strong motivating soundtrack to pump you up nor one to bring you down when needed, for me this was one of the most disjointing parts of the film .Soundtrack score 3/10Pacing
The film has a pacing issue, go figure a 3 hour movie with a pacing issue, there are scenes and segments where it is clear, this section is for laughing, this section is for going wow, this is the sad section and felt extremely stretched, the first 1 hour and a half was the hardest part to get through pacing wise, when we are so used to a full film being over by this stage, I feel there is many parts of this film that could be cut out to make it more streamline without compromising the final product.
The final act approx 1 hour 10 minutes of the film goes extremely fast while the first 2 acts seem to almost double in length when watching it. Pacing score 5/10Design
There is not much to say about the design of the world they create, everything is as it should be, the time machine looked great and believable, Thanos ships & warriors, every planet (most of which we have seen before) were done almost flawlessly - the only concern I had was the look of Thanos when moved and fought, seemed extremely ridged and choppy, not sure if that is to do with where I watched it on, but it was jarring. Design score 8.5 out of 10Re-watch ability
This is where this part of the review gets tricky, there are parts that are extremely fun and enjoyable to watch over and over again, give me the first 15 minutes and the last hour, but to go through the choppy paced part of the film when you already know what is happening, is a task, a movie like this which has many ups and downs within it, its a journey and one I will not be partaking a 3rd time any time soon. It does take a lot out of you physically and emotionally & reliving those emotional moments tends to make them less of an impact & with those moment this films climax would not stand up. Re-watch ability score 6/10Heart
This movie does have heart, it is the one key factor that I find in more of the grittier comicbook film I tend to enjoy more, there is a joyfulness that is thrown in there in times of stress , undercutting the tension of the film, this is what I call marvel-ing for everything serious you have you must immediately undercut it with something else, normally this is one of my biggest pet peeves about marvel films as of late but for what ever within the confines of this film I felt them more necessary then ever, the characters interaction with each other and the care you can see is not just an act make this movie much more than I expected. Heart score 9/10
Adding the totals I give the film a review of 70.5% Making it the 5th highest aggregate score
That being Said, I did thoroughly enjoy the film and do recommend it.

reviewTitle: Finally A Marvel Film That I Really Loved
reviewBody: If you know me well, you will know I am not a huge fan of Marvel. But this film worked so incredibly well for me! This was the perfect culmination of everything from the past 11 years, and it was everything I want personally from a Marvel Movie, which is experimenting with different genres within superhero movies (I shall not reveal said genres as that's technically a spoiler). Everyone gives their best performances as their characters in the whole saga, even Jeremy Renner, who I do like, but I acknowledge isn't great, and neither is Hawkeye. But what really pisses me off, is that the MCU is still going. This was the perfect finale, but NO, Marvel needs some more dollar-dollar. But regardless, I had a great time watching this film.

It's fantastic and beautiful

reviewTitle: Not actioned packed however...nice wrap up!
reviewBody:
The bulk of the film is set five years after the events of Infinity Wars.Ok let's start with the negatives:
CGI of some of our favourite characters appear to be slightly on the poor side. The CGI is quite noticable in some scenes.Secondly...It's very long and as a whole does not have much action. It is more dramatic. This is not a bad thing, however some fans may expect more action in this genre of film.On a postive note, it brings the characters back together very well.Unfortunately it appears this film too has become a victim of "feminism", with an unnecessary girl power "we got this" scene featuring Captain Marvel and a number of supporting female cast. Why unnecessary? Because viewers will note that Captain Marvel could have quite easily conducted the task at hand with little or no assistance.The cast have done a great job with plenty of little cameo's from our favourite and not so favourite characters of the MCU. The film presents itself as a good wrap up to the 22 film series. Prepare yourselves for some laughs and for some tears.Btw...there is no post credit scene so no need to wait till the end of the rolling credits.If you have an opportunity, go watch the film at the cinemas as it is still worth the watch in a cinematic environment. Just make sure you go to the toilet before the movie starts due to the length of the film.Happy watching!A job well done to both producers and directors.

reviewTitle: BEST MCU MOVIE THERE WILL BE
reviewBody: Amazing movie best one in mcu there is. I got disappointed with the last 5-10 mins with cap turning old and what they did to Thor which didn't get my perfect score. They were the only disappointing things everything else was everything you'd want. My heart is in pieces to see what has happened to the original six and no one could ever replace them. This movie is worth your money but I warn you. Bring tissues. You'll want them. To see 2 killed, 1 about to die, a burnt hand, a father who has a family so is a retired avenger, and now my favourite super hero is fat. This must be the end to the MCU and I hope that there isn't another avengers movie that replaces the OG avengers

Its important to understand that this is and will always be a blockbuster Disney movie - its not suppose to forever change cinema. I got what I wanted and nothing more, theres nothing bad in that of course.I think that the main actors did a pretty good job, the emotional scenes in the end worked fairly well. However a lot of scenes felt very rushed. I am aware that in three hours a franchise spanning for over 10 years was getting its closure, but it really ruined some scenes specially in the beginning.A lot of the plot points were happening because of stupid coincidences like Hulk getting down the stairs the exact moment, that was a load of bs. It was funny, I guess but it was stupid. I have that problem with every Marvel films the humour. It really hurts scenes that are suppose to make you chocked or sad. This movies is filled with these three liners and it gets repetitive very fast.Overall fun movie I dont regret watching but will not watch again. Mostly because of the run time but yeye

reviewTitle: Flash Review: A must for MCU fans, but don't think too hard
reviewBody: The Set-upThe Time Travel plot device to end the Phase 3 of the Marvel Cinematic Universe has been speculated ever since the post-credits scene from Ant-Man and the Wasp showed Scott Lang/Ant-Man getting trapped in the Quantum Realm.Any time you use Time Travel as a plot device in a movie, it raises a LOT of questions on how paradoxes are avoided. BUT this is a Marvel movie, so we wave our Sorcerer Supreme hands and ignore things that would be scrutinized in a hard science fiction film.So. Three acts.First Act: The StakesTo me this was the best part of the whole movie. We visit with the original Avengers, first a few days after the events of Infinity War, then again five years later to see how they're dealing with their losses. This is the difference between the MCU and the DCEU - the MCU spends time with the characters' motivations and the stakes involved. When they fight not just another meaningless CGI-laden battle. This act ends with the return of Scott Lang and the formulation of the plan to recover the people Thanos killed in Infinity War.Second Act: The HeistsIt's fitting that Ant-Man triggers this series of events, because this act feels like the original Ant-Man movie. Still a lot of nice interaction between the surviving heroes, and the environments that they visit. The act ends when they all succeed, but at what price?Third Act: The EndgameOf course there's a final battle to end the movie and the current Phase of the MCU, complete with transitions, consequences, surprises and all-out CGI action as only the Russos can deliver. It's a totally satisfying climactic encounter.EpiloguePeriods and question marks for the characters that we've journeyed with for twenty-two films.Post-credits scenesThere aren't any. Unless you count a post-credits sound effect, which could mean anything.Reviewer's Tilt7/10. Unfortunately I think about time travel plot holes too much, and this impacts how much I enjoyed the movie, so I docked it a point for that, but it's still a solid entry and a worthwhile end to this Phase of the MCU.

reviewTitle: Well made ending of an era but the execution was lazy
reviewBody:
First of all, from a critics perspective, the movie had everything to be a complete success. The visuals were amazing, the soundtrack was a perfect underline to every scene and the plot contained several unexpected twists. However, the movie just didn't do it for me personally.Before I start complaining, I went in that movie with high expactations, due to it being the grand finale to an 11 years ongoing era, but was open for everything to happen.Except for just enough things that made me feel like it wasn't the finale I wished to see.Starting with the attack on Thanos in the first part of the movie. It was too fast and too easy to be the follow up of Infinity War. Thanos killed our beloved characters but the revenge for it just wasn't satisfiying and felt like they want to get rid of him as fast as possible just to bring his former conquerer self on screen to have a villain to fight.
It was surprising, but it wasn't a good surprise.Second, the humour felt kinda off. Don't get me wrong, the jokes were great and I laughed at some of them, but often they were misplaced. For such a serious situation, there were to many jokes.
Fat Thor was hilarious, but I would have liked this in the probably upcoming Asguardians of the galaxy movie, where they just chill in space and get fat, but not in the finale of an era.The solution for defeating Thanos, undo the snap and what they had to do for it were just to easy. I never had the feeling, that they were risking something. For every problem, there was a fast solution. There wasn't a moment where the stakes were high. It felt like "yeah just do it".Additionally, I think the Russo brothers went full safe mode with the happenings. Everything the fans wanted to see was in it. Wich sounds great, but there wasn't any real surprise. It felt like I knew exactly what will happen next and how the movie ends (just a note here: I tried to avoid any trailers or theories, so I went in that movie only with my own thoughts about it). It was indeed a good storyline, but way to predictable.Also, the movie was slow paced, but the important scenes, for example the comeback of all characters at the final battle, did not have enough time to breathe. There was so much happening at that battle, that every reunion was so fast and rushed. More time for it would have made it more emotional.These are just a few things that bothered me. Nevertheless there are a lot of good things as well.The movie took its time to have as much of a goodbye to the characters as possible.
The chemistry between the characters was on point.
The timetravels to the old movies were a great recap of what happened.
Tony's death and the funeral were emotional as hell.Overall, the movie just isn't the worthy finale for an unbelievebly well made cinematic universe. It did everything to be a good ending but lacked the surprises as a consequence. It is a must watch for fans, but as a movie itself it is by far not as good as Infinity War.

reviewTitle: Not as quicke as the first one.
reviewBody: I was so suprised when i saw the first infinity film. Everything made sense and Worked together. But when i saw this movie some parts just didn't fit. The overall humor didn't do the movie any good. The Thor is fat and the Hulk is both strong and smart joke got old really fast. I fellt like the movie wasn't insink with the first one.The ending was satisfying but didn't make up for the rest.The first acts of the movie really were promissing but they lost it somewhere in the middel. This one is a 7 and the first one a 9.My overal problem is that this movie misses the pace the first one had.So go watch the movie and see it yourself.

reviewTitle: The best original avengers and the eternal group ofsix

reviewBody: The first 30 minutes was bit a stretch but the movie started to grow after Ant-Man shows shows up. No end credits. I enjoyed it.

What a well written final Avengers film. Bit of Captain Marvel early but it mostly focused on the original Avengers & Ant Man for the most part of the first half. Had the right amount of humour & Thor was really good in this one. The Black Widow/Hawkeye scene for the stone, I had no idea what way that was going to go. The hug between Tony & Peter had me choking up, a beautiful touch. The all female cast leading a fight scene was tremendous. Tony steps up for the ultimate sacrifice. Cap finally gets his dance. It was the perfect goodbye & they sign off at the start of the credits. A goodbye to most the originals. Done in a wonderful way that Marvel perfected.Also, No credit scene

People in the cinema were shouting and crying for joy when the Avengers who died came back to fight with Thanos. It was the best audience reaction I've ever seen! Was wondering though how Captain Marvel was able to control the Mjolnir. Unexpected deaths, two among the Avengers, and unexpected ending with regard to Steve Rogers and Hawkeye. Was expecting that Capt. Marvel would be the one to defeat Thanos, but it wasn't the case. Overall, the movie was enjoyable.
This is the best one.Where it began is where it ended

reviewTitle: Amazing, but still a bit disappointed...
reviewBody:
A personal review. I really lived up to this moment to finally see Endgame and had such high expectations. They didn't really came true though...It's absolutely worth the watch, but I think people, just like me, might be a bit disappointed.I think certain characters got way too much screentime like hawkeye and captain america, while others got way too little.
Some scenes really could be skipped, there's so much unnecessary talking and just too little action.I'm a huge Loki fan, so i really hoped he would return and would get a bigger role in this one, but elas... he is in it, luckily, but way too short. A really big missed upportunity. Of course they brought Gamora back, but no Loki.... :(
The directors just dismissed him as they have their obvious favorite characters.Thor being fat and all was funny in the beginning but later it just annoyed me. Why doing this to this great character?!Tony was great, cried my eyes out during his death scene and funeral, but the ending with cap... why give his shield to Falcon?!Many missed opportunities. The story could have been much more interesting than this obvious ending.To end positive, the special effects were amazing. You have to see this on the bigscreen.
The acting itself is also great.
So definitely worth watching, but don't expect too much ;)

reviewTitle: Amazing highs but a few too many plot holes.
reviewBody: ProsThey didn't do the obvious Captain America sacrifices himself for the cause, while it was always going to be Tony, having Black Widow sacrifice herself was a decent surprise.Fat Thor.Didn't have an over-reliance on Captain Marvel and her powers.ConsPacing just felt really weird and off to me.Having IW-Thanos so easily killed kind of eroded his potential value as a plot point and meant they relied on the really tenuous "future Nebula mind melds with current Nebula and gives away the plot so strong Thanos can re-appear"Having used Hulk to undo the decimation, having Tony Stark use the power gauntlet solely to decimate Thanos and his forces seems a bit stupid, considering with the Power Gauntlet and as Iron Man he could have easily bested them without a snap - it's a plot holeThe worst plot hole - "People that were decimated will come back and fit into a society that is five years removed from the one they left and no issues will be caused by that" - what about people who moved on? What about the lack of food and other factors? It's just lazy horrible writing.The "Girl Power" scene - I get it; I get the female cause, I get wanting a Black Captain America to get that Black Panther dollar too - but it's such lazy writing to have them all find each other on a battle field in that particular way.We're to believe Captain America from 1940 goes back to be with Peggy (now in her late forties, early 50s) and lives a life where he watches his friend Bucky get tortured by Hydra, Shield be betrayed by Hydra despite his wife being a director and all the other travesties so he can just "live his life"The bitter-sweet "But Tony and Pepper have a kid" - I think the sacrifice that could and should have been made is for Tony to realise that he has to give away the kid in order to return those that were lost to the decimation; i.e the click undoes the last five years and brings them back to the instant that Thanos clicked..

Thank you, Marvel and the Russo brothers. Maybe a little bit more credit to the other character who die. A proper burial or remembrance of some sort would have been nice. Really sorry she couldn't make it in the final battle. But what should be, will be. It was a very well paced movie, there was a slow period but overall, very nicely done. I wonder how many people wrote the screenplays.

Big Marvel fan!! Wanted to get that out of the way before I start!Its just that the way Infinity war was directed and handled overall, Endgame had to up its game and thats where it fell a bit short, I feel. I knew time travel was always in play(so its not even a spoiler); however the direction, screenplay and science of time travel part was weakly handled. I am a huge time travel concept fan(Primer and Time crimes being the best). With the slow pace in the 1st act establishing the foundation for the rest of the movie, I thought they would do justice to the science, implication and the wit of time travel. So I expected a mature take on it. Three things could have been better to complete the time travel ark:-
1. The ripples it created in the alternate timeline were spoken of but not addressed at all when things started to go south in the original timeline.
2. Smart inserts of how original movies had certain scenes which were inexplicible then could have been attributed to this movie's time travel plot. Eg. In Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, the russtle of leaves heard by Hermoine initially was understood when the time travel ark started. Something like that would have made a true Marvel fan giggle with delight. Missed a trick there.
3. Hulk explained that putting the stones back in its place will kill the offshoot timelines - meaning it could possibly invalidate the movie's timeline too!! But that was not addressed; am sure story writers had thought this through, just couldnt translate that in the screenplay.Its best moments can be summarized under 2 points:-
1. Humor (not top grade...nonethess prevalent throughout the movie)
2. NostalgiaBest handled characters in following order:-
1. Iron Man
2. Captain America
3. Thor
4. Hulk
5. Hawkeye andRaw deal for characters which were seemingly important for Phase 4 of MCU
1. Black Widow
2. Thanos
2. Dr. Strange
3. Spiderman
4. Black Panther
5. Vision (no screen time??! Unless you consider Howard Stark's driver Jarvis's voice)Although, I seem to be cynical rather than delighted fan with this review, overall I enjoyed the movie; worth a re-watch to catch the missed 1 one liners :)And if someone at Marvel is looking for Ideas to cash-in on nostalgia, Captain America's final scene can be a movie in itself(and hopefully someone will consider in future)!!!Good Luck Marvel...for Phase 4!...Looking forward to!

reviewTitle: I didn't know I was a fan but I was... But
reviewBody: I didn't know I was a fan but I was... ButFor the genre not the movie itself.I get fueled by heroism however seeing all the movies and have read 0 comics seen some animated series this end was good not great.A overal weak 6.5-6.7I am no geek for the whole package, franchise but in the impossible.I am here to share my emotions after 0 credit scene and I am full of emotions but confused, sad, empty, serenity.So I am no indepth with writers on this but I do get you want to please everyone but it becomes too much, the Thor part is probably great for many none followers and just for the average viewer, I don't think it is the writers fault but the management, vision.Cause this might the fastest 3 h you sit through and wonder what was what happens and you are left with the will of reseeing it and not in a good way.It might just be me or how I am built but even if it is 2019 and the world is what it is and actors want out, age or what not (didn't stop the cgi) it does get better with time, hence live action.So removing cast completely is just so redundant. This genre is made for the impossible why make it not so, why try and please the other half. It is not that it is unrealistic most is.People spend time remenissing most part of their life or doing things they didn't believe in until they started doing it.Sure raw and gritty but that is why you should never close a door not in this age.Having cast return should always stay open especially if you even after 2008, mind the comics, the length characters have lived even thou animated there could have been openings because the way the closed this chapter is and was rushed.This comes from me and my emotions, even my girlfriend said it was flat.Well ofcourse it was, so many characters in this with 1/3 going for slowpace, drama, not even enough time to shift paste.It is like they wanted to keep the same and all emotions from all movies and still build a story ontop and this in 3 hours time.I am all for everything and I dont need more, this is Imdb. Just using this to lead my emotions for selfclosure where the creators did not.I wish I could say all CGI in the final would satisfy me, pepper Potts spot on send off, every moment but it was a cake, you hade the sprinkle, you had layers, you had frosting but where was the passion, there was humor.You know trying to digg out something that is left missing is not easy, even if one would rage.So my gf said it was flat, as for me vs those who have more backstory and are more forgiving and accept noone can live forever.I get you. I might be that 1 procent but I am still here feeling a bit snuffed because we left the impossible behind.Maybe we don't live in a sustainable world anymore and it drives us to be more realistic and we are controlled more about numbers than guided by our own emotions.But ending it like this feels wrong, so for one printing this directly from my mind and beeing a post genius would could have been different?Well honestly it is not hard to speak for oneself.And you can't change the past as in the movies (yet)However playing with the idea is that pushing the soul stone a definite broke it all but going deeper on the same line would drag things out til the impossible.So giving the time concept multiverse would be the way to go, however. Martyrs are no longer and should have and shall never be glorified even if that embarks emotions.A true hero is one that can overcome all without self-sacrifice.I think this would and should have been the call.This leads us back to infinity war and just the strange writer decision to brand and spoil the envitable plot with the 14 miljon vs 1 outcome.For a company as any company with leaders, writers above all people with vision.A person in time gets better. An object that gets older you threat it with more respect.But with this it seems money and time talks more against than for.It is truly sad that crowd creation and funding didn't go through n before this era for fans and other followers to inject their will into the story arch as it could have.Opens up interesting view upon those who own the rights to shape and have the power to push plot, characters.For one second could have been nice with alternative ending because like Strange writers did it, 14 miljon wrong and one right.However this feel like inaccurate as for realities, infinity the soul stone sacrifice seems to be the only limit.So what is next. Well for me I will mourn Ironman the most as for the rest not as much but still..It is just truly sad everything was pushed to an end than actually have a more organic fallout.Seeing heroes grow old naturally, no time jumping leaving things over in the same pace it has been would have been nice.If I could ask a question it would have been.Why or who made you quit, was it not obvious it was done. Who pushed who, who got left behind so this happened.Was it really time for RDJ to go. And I believe not. This gap needs to be filled and if it was that easy we would have, his portrayed or joint mentality for, in and with his character people need it and copy or act it will not be possible, this is core grinded with each and one of us acting or not and cannot be copied and another replacing will not be possible cause we all realisticly could(have) see(seen) RDJ continue his journey.And this is just RDJ, there are more which falls into the same line. It is just me who connects with RDJ the strongest hence the reference.So needed to spend time writing this up to be able to go to sleep is not as good as I had hoped.But in the world we are shapeing it helps with the impossible when everyone else fails.Let that be a reminder./Cheers n take care <3

I watched this movie at the world premiere and I am absolutely speechless by the work they have done.The pacing is incredibly good, It doesn't feel like you sit there for 3hrs, more like 1 hr 50 min.The time travel aspect actually works in this movie which I like, because many movies tries time travel and it never really works or it is super complicated. The only thing I don't like about this is this is going to become such a "Deus ex Machina" to the franchise going on.There was one death that shocked me and the ending to the top 2 avengers were great. Iron man and Captain America both went out with the way I wanted them to go.I also love that characters like Hawkeye, Ant-Man, Nebula and Hulk got so much screen time.The only things I did not like about this movie is the business aspect. It's very obvious that Audi has a deal with Marvel when Tony Stark drives his Audi and parks it in front of the camera for 5 seconds flashing the logo. I also did not like the Fortnite reference with Thor and Korg. The kids in the cinema loved it but it just got way to corny.My favorite quote from the movie is Tony Stark's reference to "The Big Lebowski" that was personally my favorite joke.Marvel did it again and I seriously don't know how they can top this in phase 4.
Thank you to the Russo brothers for making an incredible masterpiece9/10
